msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso has a column at the bottom
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left; the right hand side is regularly cut in two cuts. The papyrus is badly damaged and broken at the top and bottom; there are some lacunae in several places of the column. The papyrus is also vertically broken at the end of the column as a result of two folds. An original small fragmennt has recently stuck on the Verso to support the papyrus from the damage, which very hard to be removed; it should be left to avoid any possible damage. As well as some original fragments were stuck on the back of col. 144 have been removed; they have some writings. Few spots of salt on Recto. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer and marking an oblique stroke going downwards to the left margin in other lines.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
